info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued February 25 at 3:38PM HST until February 28 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR EAST FACING SHORES OF KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI MAUI AND BIG ISLAND... .Strong trade winds will bring large and rough surf to east facing shores through this afternoon. Surf heights along east facing shores will briefly dip below advisory levels tonight through Sunday, and then rise back to advisory thresholds from Monday through much of next week with strengthening trade winds. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Surf 7 to 10 feet, dropping to 6 to 8 feet at times tonight through Sunday. * WHERE...East facing shores of Kauai, Maui, Molokai, Oahu and the Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
